item.title: Norman add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Man, unlike any other thing organic or inorganic in the universe, grows beyond his work, walks up the stairs of his concepts, and emerges ahead of his accomplishments." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Norman add a quote by Ian Caldwell
item.description: "A son is a promise that time makes to a man,the guarantee every father receives that whatever he holds dear will someday be considered foolish, and that person he loves best in the world will misunderstand him." -- Ian Caldwell

item.title: Norman add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Norman add a quote by Phil McGraw
item.description: "You can't put feathers on a dog and call it a chicken!" -- Phil McGraw

item.title: Norman add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "My ambition is handicapped by laziness" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Norman add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Poetry is what happens when nothing else can." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Norman add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "In increments both measurable and not, our childhood is stolen from us -- not always in one momentous event but often in a series of small robberies, which add up to the same loss." -- John Irving

item.title: Norman add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I believe people ought to mate for life...like pigeons or Catholics." -- Woody Allen
